intro: Spermacoce stachydea, commonly known as the white rattle, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant produces small, white, clustered flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce stachydea is often found in open woodlands and disturbed soils, thriving in warm, humid climates.
